result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kiara L Miller

records.addlTxt:
Clerk contacted the parties via email regarding hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023.
Court DOWN January 20, 2023. Parties selected a new date.
NEW DATE:

Defendant Kiara L Miller not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Kiara L Miller.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Defense advised the Court of Defendant's HOLD with DOC, Jefferson County, and Washington County. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 09:30 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
Jury Trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Kiara L Miller not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Kiara L Miller.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant was not produced, appearance waived. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material from the State. Defense requested Status hearing date to allow time to review Discovery. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 8:30 am. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Kiara L Miller in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Kiara L Miller in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Kiara L Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer O. Sathe. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with DD DOB: 4/14/1983; TD DOB: 2/20/2004; TC DOB: 2/9/2009

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kiara L Miller in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kiara L Miller in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-WARRANT
